Author: bumbumboleji
Text: Have the painkiller with a tiny bit of something  Like a coffee or whatever your safe food is have 1 or 2 bites of that   Staying hydrated is really helpful as is being aware if how tight your sholder/ neck muscles are and giving them a rub if need be   A lie down in a nice dark quiet room helps   And caffene if you can have it helps as well (not a lot just like a black tea or something)

Author: Caffe_Americano
Text: I try to make sure I’m keeping hydrated but also keeping all my electrolytes in balance especially sodium, potassium, and magnesium when my intake is low or zero. For me, dehydration = headaches. So I try to drink lots of water but if you do that without eating much you can flush all your electrolytes out which can also cause headaches. So I’ll take an electrolyte tablet (nuun, 10 cals) mixed into a liter of water and maybe eat a pinch of salt too. It helps a LOT. Maybe take a multi vit while you’re at it? I’ve also had good luck with having some caffeine to help with migraines specifically. Good luck, hope your head improves! Stay safe out there!
